intro: Androsace graceae, commonly known as the slender rock-moss, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact rosette of hairy, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a distinctive corona. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens and alpine plant collections.
